sections.heading:
REVISED  BY
THE  COMMISSIONER  OF  LAW  REVISION,  MALAYSIA
UNDER  THE AUTHORITY  OF  THE  REVISION  OF  LAWS ACT  1968
2018
sections.content:
REVISED  BY
THE  COMMISSIONER  OF  LAW  REVISION,  MALAYSIA
UNDER  THE AUTHORITY  OF  THE  REVISION  OF  LAWS ACT  1968
2018

Date  of  publication  in  the 
Gazette  of  this  revised  edition    …  …  …  1 November 2018

Date  appointed  for  coming  into 
operation  of  this  revised  edition  pursuant  to
paragraph  6(1)(xxiii)  of  the  Revision 
of  Laws Act  1968  [Act  1]  …  …  …  …  1 November 2018
First  enacted  in  1968  as Act  of  Parliament  No.  20  of  1968

sections.heading: 3.  Playing  of  the  full  version  of  the  National Anthem
sections.content: 3.  Playing  of  the  full  version  of  the  National Anthem

sections.heading: 6.  Playing  of  the  National Anthem  on  special  occasions
sections.content: 6.  Playing  of  the  National Anthem  on  special  occasions
An Act  relating  to  the  National Anthem  of  Malaysia.

sections.heading: 1.  (1)  This Act  may  be  cited  as  the  National Anthem Act  1968.
sections.content: 1.  (1)  This Act  may  be  cited  as  the  National Anthem Act  1968.

sections.heading: 2.  In  this Act,  unless  the  context  otherwise  requires—
sections.content: 2.  In  this Act,  unless  the  context  otherwise  requires—

“short version” means the short version of the National Anthem 
specified  in  the  Schedule;

“abridged version” means the abridged version of the National 
Anthem  specified  in  the  Schedule.
Playing  of  the  full  version  of  the  National Anthem

sections.heading:
3.  (1)  The  full  or  Royal  version  of  the  National  Anthem  shall 
be  played  on  the  following  occasions:
sections.content:
3.  (1)  The  full  or  Royal  version  of  the  National  Anthem  shall 
be  played  on  the  following  occasions:

(a)  when a salute is given for the Yang di-Pertuan Agong, or 
the  Timbalan  Yang  di-Pertuan  Agong  while  exercising 
the  functions  of  the Yang  di-Pertuan Agong,  or  a  Ruler

nominated to exercise the functions of the Yang di-Pertuan 
Agong  in  accordance  with  the  Yang  di-Pertuan  Agong 
(Exercise  of  Functions)  Act  1957  [Act  373],  or  when 
the  royal  standard  is  broken  to  symbolize  the  presence 
of  the  Yang  di-Pertuan Agong;
(b)  during  official  parades  or  other  official  ceremonial
(d)  when  the  flag  of  Malaysia  is  brought  on  parades;
(e)  when  regimental  colours  are  presented;  and
(f)  for  hoisting  of  the  colours  in  the  Navy.

(2)  The  full  or  Royal  version  of  the  National Anthem  may  be 
played  in  schools  for  the  purpose  of  teaching  pupils  to  sing  the 
National Anthem.

(3)  The full or Royal version of the National Anthem shall be 
played on any other occasion as the Yang di-Pertuan Agong may 
by  order  prescribe.

sections.heading:
4.  (1)  The  abridged  version  shall  be  played  as  a  salute  on  all 
official  occasions  for—
sections.content:
4.  (1)  The  abridged  version  shall  be  played  as  a  salute  on  all 
official  occasions  for—
(b)  the  Yang  di-Pertua  Negeri  of  Malacca,  Penang,  Sabah
(2)  The abridged version shall be played on any other occasion
as  the  Yang  di-Pertuan Agong  may  by  order  prescribe.

5.  On  any  official  occasion  when  the Yang  di-Pertuan Agong  or 
his representative is not present but one of the Rulers of the States 
is  present,  the  short  version  shall  be  played  at  the  conclusion 
of  the  occasion  immediately  after  the  relevant  State  anthem  has 
been  played.
Playing  of  the  National Anthem  on  special  occasions

6.  (1)  At all official receptions to foreign dignitaries at which the 
salute is given, the full or Royal version of the National Anthem 
shall  be  played  immediately  after  the  anthem  of  the  country  of 
the  visiting  dignitary  has  been  played.

(2)  At  all  official  occasions  arranged  by  foreign  Missions  in 
Malaysia  for  celebrating  their  National  Days  or  other  National 
occasions, the full or Royal version of the National Anthem shall 
be  played  immediately  after  the  anthem  of  the  country  of  the 
foreign  Mission  has  been  played.

sections.heading:
7.  On  all  occasions  when  the  National Anthem  is  sung,  the  full 
or  Royal  version  shall  be  recited.
sections.content:
7.  On  all  occasions  when  the  National Anthem  is  sung,  the  full 
or  Royal  version  shall  be  recited.

8.  (1)  Whenever the full or Royal version of the National Anthem 
is  played  or  sung  or  whenever  the  abridged  or  short  version  is 
played,  all  persons  present  shall  stand  to  attention  as  a  mark  of 
respect.

(2)  Subsection  (1)  does  not  apply  where  the  National Anthem 
is  played  or  sung  in  the  course  of  a  broadcast  or  newsreels  as 
part  of  such  broadcast  or  newsreels.

(3)  Any  person  who  knowingly  shows  disrespect  towards  the 
National Anthem in any public place shall, on conviction, be liable 
to  a  fine  not  exceeding  one  hundred  ringgit  or  to  imprisonment 
for  a  term  not  exceeding  one  month.
(4)  For  the  purpose  of  this  section—
(a)  the  failure  to  comply  with  subsection  (1)  without  good

(b)  any act or omission which would tend to lower the prestige 
of  the  National Anthem  in  the  eyes  of  the  public,
shall  constitute  a  show  of  disrespect.

9.  A  police  officer  may  arrest  without  warrant  any  person  who 
contravenes section 8 in the presence of the police officer unless 
the  person  gives  his  name  and  address  and  satisfies  such  officer 
that  he  will  duly  answer  any  summons  or  other  proceedings  that 
will  be  taken  against  him.

sections.heading:
10.  The Yang  di-Pertuan Agong  may  by  order  amend,  substitute 
or  vary  the  Schedule.
sections.content:
10.  The Yang  di-Pertuan Agong  may  by  order  amend,  substitute 
or  vary  the  Schedule.

For  full  or  royal  version,  play  from  beginning  to  end
For abridged version, play from beginning to B and continue from C 
to  end
For  short  version,  play  from  C  to  end

PERCETAKAN NASIONAL MALAYSIA BERHAD
Semua Hak Terpelihara. Tiada mana-mana bahagian jua daripada penerbitan ini boleh diterbitkan semula atau disimpan di dalam bentuk
yang boleh diperolehi semula atau disiarkan dalam sebarang bentuk dengan apa jua cara elektronik, mekanikal, fotokopi, rakaman dan/
atau sebaliknya tanpa mendapat izin daripada Percetakan Nasional Malaysia Berhad (Pencetak kepada Kerajaan Malaysia yang
dilantik).
